attributes.action: take positive action regarding methane emission - a worse factor to global warming
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the news, we hear all about taxing big engine cars, airline fuel taxes and reducing your carbon footprint on this planet. It's all great but there's a big piece of the jigsaw missing.

The gas Methane is ten (10) times more harmful than Co2 in it's effect in causing global warming.

Cattle produce a massive amount of methane each day. Coupled with a population all increasing their meat intake, how come this issue isn't being addressed as it should be.

Imagine 1.3 billion cattle each burping methane several times a minute, it doesn't require much more thinking to envisage the effect of that on our environment.

The Food & Agricultural Organisation of the United Nations have mentioned this but nothing had made it's way into mainstream media or the public.

This is a major contributor to global warming and it seems the government and the media are turning a blind eye to it. Why?
